comments:
When running eclipse 3.0M9, Eclipse failed after the  "Splash Screen" (and
before "Select Workspace") with a pop-up dialog saying
"An error had occured. Please see log file
/path/to/logfile/file.log"

It occurs for both Motif and GTK2 version. The log file content is labelled as
LogFileStartup at the end of this description.

My Setup:
1. login as non-root user
2. Download j2sdk_1.4.2, install it in /home/co224/bin directory, say.
3. Download eclipse, install it in /home/co224/bin dir also
4. execute 
     cd /home/co224/bin/eclipse; 
     export PATH=/home/co224/bin/j2sdk_1.4.2/bin:$PATH
     ./eclipse

The procedure works for eclipse 2.1.3. But not on Eclipse M9. I tried
j2sdk_1.4.1 as well. Same problem.

I posted this problem on the newsgroup (3.0M9 startup problem. First post  24
May) and got these following tips:

On the suggestion of Pascal Rapicault, I tried the argument -Dosgi.locking, i.e.
  ./eclipse -Dosgi.locking
  ./eclipse -Dosgi.locking=java.io
  ./eclipse -Dosgi.locking=none
  ./eclipse -Dosgi.locking=java.nio

All did not prevent the problem. But the log file is different. The log file for
the first one above is LogFileOSGI at the end of this description.

Brian Kozitza, in the newsgroup discussion, says that he experience the same
problem on AIX Motif, his log file is LogFileAIX below. He traced the problem to
Network File System, in his case, AFS. He reported that putting Eclipse on the
local file system will prevent this problem.

On my original installation /home/co224/bin is on a NFS with Legato Backend. So
I put the eclipse directory onto the local file system. This trick works for
GTK2 version, but not Motif version. The logfile provided below under
LogFileLocalFileSystem.

Unfortunately, running eclipse under local file system is not a solution for me.

A big thank you to everyone who had contributed to this bug report. And a big
thank you to everyone who will be dealing with this bug report too.





--Log files
